g.title: principlesofperformance
FivePrinciples
PeopleMakeMistakes
FivePrinciples--PeopleMakeMistakes
LearningAndImproving
FivePrinciples--LearningAndImproving
ContextDrivesBehavior
FivePrinciples--ContextDrivesBehavior
HowYouRespond
FivePrinciples--HowYouRespond
BlameFixesNothing
FivePrinciples--BlameFixesNothing
Errors are normal
PeopleMakeMistakes--Errors are normal
Since error is a normal state of existence,\nerror is never causal
g.text: Since error is a normal state of existence,

g.title: PeopleMakeMistakes--Since error is a normal state of existence,\nerror is never causal
Error is not the opposite of success.\nError is a part of being successful
g.text: Error is not the opposite of success.
Error is a part of being successful

g.title: PeopleMakeMistakes--Error is not the opposite of success.\nError is a part of being successful
Error exists in success as well as failure
g.text: Error exists in success as well as failure

g.title: PeopleMakeMistakes--Error exists in success as well as failure
Errors are not choices\nError only becomes a choice in retrospect
g.text: Error only becomes a choice in retrospect

g.title: PeopleMakeMistakes--Errors are not choices\nError only becomes a choice in retrospect
You can’t remove error\nso you must defend against\nthe inevitability of error
PeopleMakeMistakes--You can’t remove error\nso you must defend against\nthe inevitability of error
Good systems\nbuild in error tolerance
PeopleMakeMistakes--Good systems\nbuild in error tolerance
Knowing errors will happen\nis a good thing
PeopleMakeMistakes--Knowing errors will happen\nis a good thing
An error without significance consequence\nis the closest thing to a\nleading indicator data you will find
g.text: is the closest thing to a
leading indicator data you will find

g.title: PeopleMakeMistakes--An error without significance consequence\nis the closest thing to a\nleading indicator data you will find

Organizations have
two choices when responding to failure:
to learn and improve
or to blame and punish
g.text: two choices when responding to failure:

g.title:
LearningAndImproving--Organizations have
two choices when responding to failure:
to learn and improve
or to blame and punish
Learning is a strategic and operational\nchoice towards improvement
g.text: Learning is a strategic and operational

g.title: LearningAndImproving--Learning is a strategic and operational\nchoice towards improvement
Learning is a deliberate\nimprovement strategy
LearningAndImproving--Learning is a deliberate\nimprovement strategy
Knowing how work is done is difficult
g.text: Knowing how work is done is difficult

g.title: LearningAndImproving--Knowing how work is done is difficult
Workers are the experts,\nthe profound users of the work process
g.text: the profound users of the work process

g.title: LearningAndImproving--Workers are the experts,\nthe profound users of the work process
Workers always complete the process design
g.text: Workers always complete the process design

g.title: LearningAndImproving--Workers always complete the process design

Defenses are placed in systems,
tested in systems,
and strengthed in systems
by learning how successful work is done
g.text: by learning how successful work is done

g.title:
LearningAndImproving--Defenses are placed in systems,
tested in systems,
and strengthed in systems
by learning how successful work is done
Workers do what they do for a reason.\nAnd the reason makes sense\nto the worker given the context
g.text: Workers do what they do for a reason.
to the worker given the context

g.title: ContextDrivesBehavior--Workers do what they do for a reason.\nAnd the reason makes sense\nto the worker given the context
Complex systems don’t lend themselves\nto traditional metrics
ContextDrivesBehavior--Complex systems don’t lend themselves\nto traditional metrics
Local rationale is information to be discovered,\nnot to be weaponized
g.text: Local rationale is information to be discovered,

g.title: ContextDrivesBehavior--Local rationale is information to be discovered,\nnot to be weaponized
The environment in which work occurs\nmainly determines workers\nbehavior and actions
g.text: The environment in which work occurs

g.title: ContextDrivesBehavior--The environment in which work occurs\nmainly determines workers\nbehavior and actions
Individual behavior is influenced\nby the organizational processes and values
g.text: by the organizational processes and values

g.title: ContextDrivesBehavior--Individual behavior is influenced\nby the organizational processes and values
You have two choices:\ngetting better or getting even
HowYouRespond--You have two choices:\ngetting better or getting even
You can blame and punish,\nor you can learn and improve,\nbut you can’t do both
g.text: or you can learn and improve,

g.title: HowYouRespond--You can blame and punish,\nor you can learn and improve,\nbut you can’t do both
You create the feedback systems you have
g.text: You create the feedback systems you have

g.title: HowYouRespond--You create the feedback systems you have
Managers shape how organizations learn\nby their reaction to failure
HowYouRespond--Managers shape how organizations learn\nby their reaction to failure
Every aspect of improvement is contingent\non leadership’s deliberate decision to get better
g.text: Every aspect of improvement is contingent
on leadership’s deliberate decision to get better

g.title: HowYouRespond--Every aspect of improvement is contingent\non leadership’s deliberate decision to get better
People are watching you
HowYouRespond--People are watching you
Blame is emotionally important,\nbut not operationally important
BlameFixesNothing--Blame is emotionally important,\nbut not operationally important
Blame makes error a choice in retrospect
g.text: Blame makes error a choice in retrospect

g.title: BlameFixesNothing--Blame makes error a choice in retrospect
Blame takes up emotional and intellectual\nspace with little added value
g.text: Blame takes up emotional and intellectual

g.title: BlameFixesNothing--Blame takes up emotional and intellectual\nspace with little added value
Blame misdirects resources and strategies
BlameFixesNothing--Blame misdirects resources and strategies
Blame is the opposite of encouragement
g.text: Blame is the opposite of encouragement

g.title: BlameFixesNothing--Blame is the opposite of encouragement
